personality.title: Aetherius
personality.look: You meet a unicorn. This stallion, however, lacks the beauty and tranquility of most of the race. His fur is ragged, and he has a bitter, haunted look in his eyes.
personality.name: "Welcome, humans. I am Aetherius," he says. His voice is rough and uneven.
personality.job: "I am in mourning for my mate."

personality.title: Aeliopol
personality.look: You come face to face with a unicorn, one of the most graceful, beautiful creatures in existence. This specimen, however, is not tranquil. In fact, it seems agitated by your presence.
personality.name: "I am Aeliopol," it says in a deep, quiet voice.
personality.job: "I spend my days here in quiet contemplation."

personality.title: Aeriassa
personality.look: You meet a unicorn. It stands about five feet high (plus another foot for the horn), and its body is the living embodiment of equine perfection. When you approach, it walks up to you, unworried by your presence.
personality.name: "I am called Aeriassa."
personality.job: "I am one of the three unicorns living in this modest citadel. It is our place of exile, where we reside until we can return home."
personality.unknown: "I am afraid I can't help you."

node.text: It snorts, angrily. "Three, but once four. One of our number, Aessoforus, was brutally murdered."
She scratches the ground with the tip of her horn, an unmistakable sign of unicorn anger. "The giants to the south hunted her, slaughtered her, and took her horn as a trophy! Unforgivable!"
"You can hear more of this sad tale from Aetherius."
"She was his mate. She lives in the northwest dome."

"Like the humans down here, we have been victimized savagely by the evils of the Empire. Their Emperor Hawthorne (now happily deceased) decided that the surface should be purged of magical creatures."
"Purged. Meaning slain."
"Nothing is more magical than a unicorn. Thus, many of our number were hunted and slain by the savages of the surface. The rest of us went into hiding."

"Several of us, for example, came here. Fortunately, we unicorns carry the living embodiment of nature wherever we grow. Grass grows here, because we will it. The caverns themselves shape themselves to be more to our liking."
"Yet someday, we have but one goal."
"We wish to frolic and run on the surface world again. What more can we wish?"
"We only wish to have a place of beauty and peace in the ugly, cruel caverns. Here, for example, people may come for healing."
Aeriassa
"It is of no import. Honesty is in my nature, so I must tell you that your presence causes me great discomfort."
"Normally, I would not speak of it with you. However, because of the assistance which you have rendered to us, I will tell you of the surrounding caves."
"Go speak with Aeriassa. She will tell you of the circumstances that have led to us being forced into the underworld. She has retained a friendliness to humans. I have not."
"She is my sometimes mate. She lives in a nearby dome."
"You are traveling through these caverns, are you not? I have wandered through them more than the others. I can warn you of some of the creatures ahead."
"There are all manner of undead, lizards, and other pests. Two beings you should know about, however, are Morog and Khoth. They are beings which should not be dealt with lightly."
"Morog is a lich."

"A lich is a magical being, a great wizard in life who turned her power into life unending. Many such creatures are unceasing in their malevolence. Morog, on the other hand, has a peculiar sense of honor."
"She often deals with those who enter her fortress, providing rewards for assistance in her magical experiments. Should you deal with her in this way, I give you a warning."
"If she gives you her word, it can be relied upon. However, she is not above trying to trick you out of your reward, once you have it. Evaluate any offers she gives you carefully before accepting."
"I know little of Khoth. I know that he is a dragon and lives at the north end of these caverns. He will not let any pass his fortress without payment of tribute."
"He requires that all who would pass his fortress give him an item of special value."

"How should I know what a dragon would consider of value? That is something you must discuss with him. However, I cannot help but believe that there must be several things in these caves that would be seen by him as adequate."
"For my poor mate, Aessoforus, who was slain by vicious giants. They butchered her, and stole her horn!"
"A lovelier being has never walked anywhere on Earth, above or below. Her horn glowed with the light of a star."
"Savage, thoughtless beings. We do them no harm, but they hunt us for their amusement anyway. Our horns hold great fascination to them. They are a foul, peculiar tribe."
"They take unending delight in fighting and give honor on the basis of how much pain an individual has suffered."
Aetherius looks at you hopefully. "My mate's horn? Do you have it?" You say you don't. He lowers his head.
"Reward? What have you done to earn a reward?"
"The horn charm will let you pass a gate to the north, which will make your task much easier. In addition, although Aeliopol is loathe to speak with humans, I have convinced him to assist you."
"He lives in the southwest dome. Speak with him."
"You will know it when you find it. It will block your progress. It was put there to protect us from Morog's minions."
"Aeliopol can tell you more of Morog."
"There is no need. You have been of great help to me."
"Aessoforus lived in the northeast dome. We have collected some supplies there, to aid those who might help recover her horn. Feel free to help yourself."
"Handi is a bit of a wanderer. Not all of our kind are suited to living in one place."
